abstract: Qualcomm hopes to spur sales for its Flo TV video service for cellphones by cutting the price and adding service on the iPhone.
snippet: Qualcomm hopes to spur sales for its Flo TV video service for cellphones by cutting the price and adding service on the iPhone.
lead_paragraph: It’s easy to be skeptical about Flo TV, Qualcomm’s effort to bring a mini cable system to your cellphone. The company offers up to 20 channels of TV for $15 a month and up. It is betting that consumers will value it even though more and more video content is available free on demand to any smartphone with streaming video capacity. What’s more, Flo only works on a handful of handsets available from AT&T and Verizon.

headline.main: The Price Goes Down for Flo TV
